Description: Reproduction mould-made pottery lamp decorated on the discus with a head of Vitellius; inscribed "IMPERATOR A.VITELLIVS"; there is an air-hole. On the nozzle is the number IX. The shoulder is decorated in relief with ovules. At the rear is a ring handle, the spine flanked by triple curved grooves. Within the base-ring is the relief inscription SVCESSI, with a leaf or small dolphin after the final letter; above is an anchor, below a ring-and-dot pattern. Covered with brown paint, with black paint on the nozzle, and applied incrustation.
Curator's comments: Probably made for the souvenir market, between 1870 and 1939.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3435)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr Laurie A Lawrence
